data.title: Are thinner people harming the environment? Novo emissions rise on Wegovy demand
data.description:
Novo Nordisk (NVO) said on Wednesday that its emissions rose by nearly a quarter in 2024 and will continue to increase up to 2030 as production increases to meet demand for its obesity blockbuster Wegovy.

In its 2024 annual report, Novo Nordisk said its scope 3 emissions, which account for 96% of its total, continue to rise. The drugmaker remains committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2045, and aims to cut scope 3 emissions by a third from 2024 to 2033.

These measures will include switching to low-carbon materials and feedstock in its production network, shifting distribution to low-emissions transportation and supporting suppliers in transitioning to renewable energy. More than 1,800 suppliers have committed to the transition, according to Novo Nordisk.

However, Katrine DiBona, vice president of sustainability at Novo Nordisk, told Reuters that some measures will not be available until years later, and emissions will continue to rise up to 2030.

While sustainability efforts have little impact on stock valuation, it will be interesting to see how its key rival Eli Lilly’s (LLY) emissions have been impacted by soaring demand for weight loss drugs. Wegovy added DKK 19.9B in sales in Q4, over a twofold rise from a year ago.

Eli Lilly (LLY) is due to report its own Q4 results tomorrow, with a consensus EPS estimate of $5.11 and revenue estimate of $13.42B for the quarter.

data.title: Svenska Handelsbanken AB reports FY results
data.description:
• Svenska Handelsbanken AB press release (OTCPK:SVNLF): FY Operating profit was SEK 35,016m.
  • Return on equity was 14.6%.
  • Earnings per share amounted to SEK 13.86.
  • The common equity tier 1 ratio was 18.8%.
  • The Board of Directors proposes an ordinary dividend of SEK 7.50 per share and a special dividend of SEK 7.50 per share.

data.title: LiveWire Group GAAP EPS of -$0.11, revenue of $10.76M
data.description:
• LiveWire Group press release (NYSE:LVWR): Q4 GAAP EPS of -$0.11.
  • Revenue of $10.76M (-28.7% Y/Y).

  • For the full year 2025, the Company expects:

    • Electric Motorcycle sales of 1,000 to 1,500 revenue units
    • LiveWire Group operating loss of $70 to $80 million

  • Fourth Quarter 2024 Summary of Results

    • Unit sales of 236, a 138% increase over third quarter 2024
    • Consolidated operating loss decreased by $8.5 million from 2023 driven by a decrease in consolidated selling, administrative and engineering expense
    • Aligned the Company’s go-to-market strategy with Europe moving to a wholesale model and entered Spain and Italy markets

data.title: Crédit Agricole S.A. reports Q4 results
data.description:
• Crédit Agricole S.A. press release (OTCPK:CRARF): Q4 underlying revenues amounted to €9,840 million, up +13.4% compared to the fourth quarter of 2023.
  • Underlying operating expenses were up +2.4% in fourth quarter 2024, totalling €5,824 million.
  • The underlying gross operating income came to €4,017 million, up +34.3% compared to the fourth quarter 2023.
  • Underlying net income Group share was €2,190 million, +33.7% higher than in the fourth quarter of 2023.

data.title: Reynolds Consumer Products beats Q4 top-line estimates; initiates Q1 and FY25 outlook
data.description:
• Reynolds Consumer Products press release (NASDAQ:REYN): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.58 in-line.
  • Revenue of $1.02B (+1.0% Y/Y) beats by $48.07M.
  • Retail Net Revenues of $975 million vs. $972 million in Q4 2023.
  • Non-Retail Net Revenues of $46 million vs. $35 million in Q4 2023.
  • EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA of $213 million vs. $238 million in Q4 2023.
  • Retail volume grew 1%.

  • Cash and cash equivalents were $137 million at December 31, 2024, and debt was $1,686 million resulting in net debt of $1,549 million, which resulted in Net Debt Leverage of 2.3x on December 31, 2024.

    Operating cash flow of $489 million for the year ended December 31, 2024 was driven by strong profitability and disciplined working capital management.

    Capital expenditures were $120 million for the year ended December 31, 2024 compared to $104 million in the prior year.

  • Fiscal Year 2025 and First Quarter 2025 Outlook:

    Full-year 2025 Net Revenues are expected to be down low single digits versus 2024 Net Revenues of $3,695 million vs. estimated growth of 1.72% Y/Y, with retail volume at or above category performance. Full-year 2025 Adjusted EBITDA is expected to be between $670 million and $690 million. Full-year Adjusted EPS is expected to be $1.61 to $1.68 vs. $1.76 consensus.

    First quarter 2025 Net Revenues are expected to be down low single digits vs. estimated growth of 1.20% Y/Y, versus first quarter 2024 Net Revenues of $833 million which considers the Easter timing shift. First quarter 2025 Adjusted EBITDA is expected to be approximately $115 million to $120 million. First quarter Adjusted EPS is expected to be $0.22 to $0.24 vs. $0.26 consensus.

    Full-year 2025 Adjusted EBITDA and Adjusted EPS reflect the following estimated adjustments from Net Income: depreciation and amortization of approximately $130 million and $25 million to $35 million of pre-tax costs related to CEO transition and other investments in certain strategic initiatives.

data.title: Vishay Intertechnology Non-GAAP EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.08, revenue of $714.7M misses by $6.81M
data.description:
• Vishay Intertechnology press release (NYSE:VSH): Q4 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.00 misses by $0.08.
  • Revenue of $714.7M (-9.0% Y/Y) misses by $6.81M.
  • 4Q 2024 book-to-bill of 1.01, with book-to-bill of 0.99 for semiconductors and 1.03 for passive components
  • Backlog at quarter end was 4.4 months
  • 1Q 2025 OutlookFor the first quarter of 2025, management expects revenues in the range of $710 million +/- $20 million and a gross profit margin in the range of 19.0% +/- 50 basis points, including the negative impact of approximately of 175-200 basis points related to Newport.
